Package monkey.ai

Interface State<Self extends State<Self,​Action>,​Action>

  • Type Parameters:
    Self - The class implementing the interface.
    Action - The type of the moves of the game.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Board
    public interface State<Self extends State<Self,​Action>,​Action>
extends java.lang.Cloneable
    A State represents a single scenario between those which can be encountered when playing a deterministic, turn-taking, two-player, zero-sum games of perfect information. Backtracking and alpha-beta pruning support is included. See S. Russell, P. Norvig, Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, 3rd ed., Prentice Hall, p. 166f. A circular type definition is needed in order to declare methods returning the correct kind of instances of State. See K. Arnold, J. Gosling, D. Holmes, The Java Programming Language, 4th ed., Addison-Wesley Professional, p. 148.
    Since:
    1.0

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.Iterator<Action> actions()
      Defines the set of legal Actions, excluding the irrelevant ones.
      Self clone()
      Creates a clone of this object.
      Action convertToHashedAction​(Action a)
      Let r be the hashing representant for this State; if a is a legal action for this State, then this method computes the analogue action for r.
      int countRelevantActions()
      Computes the number of legal, relevant actions for the current State.
      int eval​(Player p)
      Returns an estimate of the expected utility of the game from the current State for a certain Player.
      int initialAlpha​(Player p)
      Defines the alpha value of the relative initial State for a certain Player.
      int initialBeta​(Player p)
      Defines the beta value of the relative initial State for a certain Player.
      boolean isLegal​(Action a)
      Checks if a certain Action is legal.
      int overestimatedHeight()
      Computes an overestimate of the height of the game tree whose root is this State.
      Player player()
      Defines which Player should play next.
      Self result​(Action a)
      Defines the result of a certain move updating the State accordingly.
      Self revert()
      Reverts the state to its parent.
      Action revertFromHashedAction​(Action a)
      Let r be the hashing representant for this State; if a is a legal action for r, then this method computes the analogue action for this State.
      boolean terminalTest()
      Checks for terminal States.
      int ttSuggestedCapacity()
      Suggests a reasonable transposition table capacity assuming this instance is used as initial State.
      int utility​(Player p)
      When called on a terminal State, defines the payoff of such an ending for a certain Player.

      • utility

        int utility​(Player p)
        When called on a terminal State, defines the payoff of such an ending for a certain Player.
        Parameters:
        p - The Player whose payoff is to be returned.
        Returns:
        The payoff for Player p.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalCallerException - Non-terminal State.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - The Player is null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        terminalTest()
